subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|相|心|t2=heart, mind|ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s}} – to think, to consider.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: From {{och-l|相|to observe; appearance}} (“appearance > to visualise > to think”).

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=xiǎng
|dg=щён2
|c=soeng2
|h=pfs=sióng
|md=siōng
|mn=xm,tp,kh,sx,yl,km,mg,hc,tc:siūⁿ/qz,lk,ph:siǔⁿ/zz,tn,md:siōⁿ/pn:siāuⁿ/qz,tw,xm:sióng/zz:siáng
|mn_note=siūⁿ/siǔⁿ/siōⁿ - vernacular; sióng/siáng - literary
|mn-t=siên6/sion6/siang2
|mn-t_note=siên6/sion6 - vernacular (siên6 - Chaozhou); siang2 - literary
|w=2xian
|mc=y
|oc=y
|ma=y
|cat=v
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: * In the sense of want or desire, {{zh-l|想}} is also used as [[would like]]. It also appears together with {{zh-l|要|'''yào'''}} as {{zh-l|想要}} to mean "would like".
